content.question: A thick coaxial cable carries a current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> to the left in the inner wire of radius <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>, and a current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> to the right in the thick outer shell of inner radius <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> and outer radius <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>c</mi></math>. What is the magnitude of the magnetic field in the outer shell as a function of <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> for <math alttext="b less than r, less than c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mpadded><mi>b</mi><mo><</mo><mi>r</mi><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi></mpadded></mpadded></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, times I, and denominator pi r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, times I, and denominator 2 pi r, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction with numerator r squared, and denominator c squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, times I, and denominator 2 pi r, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator c squared minus r squared, and denominator c squared minus b squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, times I, and denominator 2 pi r, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator c squared minus r squared, and denominator c squared minus b squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
